repositories.brief_summary: Relocatable OCaml framework merged with runtime search capabilities and domain backtrace inheritance
repositories.new_features_summary: Relocatable OCaml with runtime IDs, domain backtrace inheritance, Unix socket improvements, new compiler flags
repositories.new_features:
- **Relocatable OCaml** implementation by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) allows runtime and compilers to locate the Standard Library relative to binary installation locations via new `--with-relative-libdir` configure option, removing embedded absolute paths ([#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244))
- **Runtime IDs and filename mangling** system introduced for harmonious coexistence of different runtime configurations and versions on a single system, with mangled names for `ocamlrun` variants, DLL runtimes, and stub libraries ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Runtime search capabilities** for bytecode executables via new `-runtime-search` flag (disable/fallback/enable modes) and `-launch-method` option (exe/sh/custom interpreter path) allowing flexible interpreter location ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Domain backtrace inheritance** feature ensures spawned domains record backtraces when parent domain has enabled it, implemented by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) ([#14416](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14416))
- **Unix socket address length handling** improvements by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) enhance Haiku compatibility ([#14406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14406))
- **New compiler flag** `-set-runtime-default` added to both `ocamlc` and `ocamlopt` for overriding default Standard Library location in executables ([#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244))
- **New compiler flag** `-dllib-suffixed` for recording mangled C shared library names with Runtime ID and host information ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Enhanced ocamlobjinfo** now displays runtime invoked by bytecode executables through RNTM section analysis or shebang line parsing ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **CMT file stripping** now always removes typing environment with removal of `OCAML_BINANNOT_WITHENV` environment variable by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([#14373](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14373))
- **Breaking change** removing support for `let rec (module M : S) = e1 in e2` syntax by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) ([#14388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14388))
- **AddressSanitizer on MSVC** progress with fixes for `CAMLno_asan` definition by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([#14414](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14414))
- **Pack prefix rewriting** fix replacing dots with appropriate separators resolving macOS issues ([d627617](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d627617bc3c89bd0689e0820c4fe6d879c8b51ba))
- **Documentation improvements** including AsciiDoc file fixes, added markup and cross-references by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([#14392](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14392))
- **Build system enhancements** with new `--enable-runtime-search` and `--enable-runtime-search-target` configure options controlling bytecode binary runtime search behavior ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Windows prefix handling** improvements on Cygwin/MSYS2 preserving backslashes in supplied `--prefix` for native Windows targets ([#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244))

repositories.trends_summary: Infrastructure modernization focus with relocatable installations, runtime flexibility, and platform compatibility

repositories.brief_summary: Two RFCs merged: transparent ascription for module system and relocatable OCaml compiler
repositories.new_features_summary: Transparent ascription with static aliases and relocatable OCaml compiler distribution
repositories.new_features:
- **Transparent ascription and static aliases** proposal merged ([#54](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/54)) introducing transparent signatures `module X : (= P :> S)` to preserve module identities and type equalities, splitting module aliases into static (absent, used with `-no-alias-deps`) and dynamic (present) variants, enabling transparent ascription for functor parameters and applications, and adding new attributes (`@static_alias`, `@dynamic_alias`) for user control over aliasing behavior
- **Relocatable OCaml compiler distribution** proposal merged ([#53](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/53)) enabling compiler installations to be moved or copied to different filesystem locations without rebuilding, introducing `--with-relative-libdir` configure option to locate Standard Library relative to compiler binaries, adding `-runtime-search` option for bytecode executables to search for `ocamlrun` in multiple locations (current directory and PATH), implementing DLL name mangling scheme with host-triplet and runtime identifier suffixes to prevent version conflicts, and using `%standard_library_default` primitive with linker support to compute library locations at runtime
repositories.activity_summary: Two RFCs merged after receiving stakeholder consensus
repositories.activity:
- **Transparent ascription RFC** by [Clément Blaudeau](https://github.com/clementblaudeau) merged after receiving support from relevant stakeholders ([#54](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/54)), proposing redesign of module aliasing mechanism to split aliases into static and dynamic variants, introduce transparent signatures preserving module identities and type equalities, and enable transparent ascription of functor parameters and applications
- **Relocatable OCaml RFC** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) merged after all implementation PRs completed ([#53](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/53)), enabling OCaml compiler distributions to be moved or copied without rebuilding through relative Standard Library paths, runtime search mechanisms, DLL name mangling, and debugging information mapping
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on module system improvements and compiler portability
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Module system evolution** continues with formal RFC process validating designs that enhance expressiveness while maintaining soundness, as seen with transparent ascription building on prior work around module aliases, applicative functors, and type-level sharing ([#54](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/54))
- **Compiler portability and distribution** improvements addressing practical deployment needs for opam switches and package management, enabling compiler installations to be moved or cloned without rebuilding ([#53](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/53))
- **RFC process maturing** with proposals receiving thorough review, implementation validation before acceptance, and clear stakeholder consensus requirements before merging

repositories.new_features:
- **Untagged integer array support** added for `int8#`, `int16#`, and `int#` arrays with packed storage and new stdlib functions `Sys.max_untagged_int8_array_length`, `Sys.max_untagged_int16_array_length`, and `Sys.max_untagged_int_array_length` ([#4643](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4643))
- **Float64/Int64 cast builtins** marked as `[@@builtin]` in `Int64.of_float` and `Int64.to_float` enabling direct static casts without runtime overhead ([#5114](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5114))
- **Register allocation affinity** added to all three allocators (IRC, linscan, greedy) to prefer physical registers with high move affinity between temporaries ([#5059](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5059))
- **CFG peephole optimization** that eliminates integer operations when the immediate operand is a neutral element like adding zero or multiplying by one ([#4932](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4932))
- Fixed illegal expression re-orderings in `to_cmm` that could cause segfaults by introducing validity tracking for safe transformations ([#4941](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4941))
- Fixed code size computation bugs in switch optimizations for `Boolean_not` switches ([#5121](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5121)) and lookup table conversions ([#5120](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5120))
- Fixed primitive removal accounting to properly handle canonicalized arguments during inlining decisions ([#5118](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5118))
- Added profiling counters to track speculative inlining that doesn't decrease code size for debugging optimization issues ([#5116](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5116))
- Improved modal inclusion error messages for better type system diagnostics ([#5112](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5112))
- **Documentation updates** for small numbers extension describing packed storage for `int8# array` and `int16# array` with representation details ([f042d631c^..71aae05ca](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/compare/f042d631c^..71aae05ca))

group_summaries.new_features_summary: Relocatable OCaml, runtime search, domain backtrace inheritance, transparent module ascription RFC
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Relocatable OCaml implementation** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) allows runtime and compilers to locate the Standard Library relative to binary installation locations via new `--with-relative-libdir` configure option, removing embedded absolute paths in [ocaml/ocaml#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244), with corresponding RFC merged in [ocaml/RFCs#53](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/53)
- **Runtime IDs and filename mangling** system introduced for harmonious coexistence of different runtime configurations and versions on a single system, with mangled names for `ocamlrun` variants, DLL runtimes, and stub libraries in [ocaml/ocaml#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245)
- **Runtime search capabilities** for bytecode executables via new `-runtime-search` flag (disable/fallback/enable modes) and `-launch-method` option (exe/sh/custom interpreter path) allowing flexible interpreter location in [ocaml/ocaml#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245)
- **Domain backtrace inheritance** feature ensures spawned domains record backtraces when parent domain has enabled it, implemented by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) in [ocaml/ocaml#14416](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14416)
- **Transparent ascription and static aliases** RFC merged in [ocaml/RFCs#54](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/54) introducing transparent signatures `module X : (= P :> S)` to preserve module identities and type equalities, splitting module aliases into static (absent, used with `-no-alias-deps`) and dynamic (present) variants, enabling transparent ascription for functor parameters and applications
- **Unix socket address length handling** improvements by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) enhance Haiku compatibility in [ocaml/ocaml#14406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14406)
- **New compiler flags** including `-set-runtime-default` for overriding default Standard Library location ([ocaml/ocaml#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244)) and `-dllib-suffixed` for recording mangled C shared library names with Runtime ID ([ocaml/ocaml#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Enhanced ocamlobjinfo** now displays runtime invoked by bytecode executables through RNTM section analysis or shebang line parsing in [ocaml/ocaml#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245)
- **CMT file stripping** now always removes typing environment with removal of `OCAML_BINANNOT_WITHENV` environment variable by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) in [ocaml/ocaml#14373](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14373)
- **Breaking change** removing support for `let rec (module M : S) = e1 in e2` syntax by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) in [ocaml/ocaml#14388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14388)
